title: Kida's formula for graphs with ramifications
abstract:
Recently Iwasawa theory for graphs is developing. A significant achievement
includes an analogue of Iwasawa class number formula, which describes the
asymptotic growth of the numbers of spanning trees for $\mathbb{Z}_p$-coverings
of graphs. Moreover, an analogue of Kida's formula concerning the behavior of
the $\lambda$- and $\mu$-invariants is obtained for unramified coverings. In
this paper, we establish Kida's formula for possibly ramified coverings.
